gurmukhi: jYsy Gwm qIKn qpiq Aiq ibKm bYsMqir ibhUn isiD kriq n gRws kau
transliteration: Jaisay Ghaam Teekhan Tapati Ati Bikhama , Baisantari Bihoon Sidhi Karati N Graas Kau ?
translation: Just as the Sun may be very harsh and hot but one is unable to cook food without fire.

gurmukhi: jYsy ins Es kY sjl hoq myr iqn ibnu jl pwn n invwrq ipAws kau
transliteration: Jaisay Nis Aos Kai Sajal Hot Mayr Tina , Binu Jal Paan N Nivaarat Piaas Kau ?
translation: Just as dew drenches mountains and hay at night but without drinking water, that dew cannot satiate anyone's thirst.

gurmukhi: jYsy hI gRIKm ruq pRgtY pRsyd AMg imtq n PUky ibnu pvnu pRgws kau
transliteration: Jaisay Hee Greekham Rout Pragatai Prasayd Anga , Mitat N Dhookay Binu Pavanu Pragaas Kau ?
translation: Just as body perspires during summer season that cannot be dried by blowing at it. Fanning alone dries it and gives comfort.

gurmukhi: qYsy AwvwgOn n imtq n Awn dyv syv gurmuK pwvY inj pd ky invws kau ]471]
transliteration: Taisay Aavaagaoun N Mitat N Aan Dayv Sayva , Gurmoukh Paavai Nij Pad Kay Nivaas Kau ?471?
translation: Similarly, serving gods cannot emancipate one from repeated births and deaths. One can achieve the higher spiritual state by becoming an obedient disciple of the True Guru.  (471)
